title: Presentation (Video): OpenAI Models for Topic Modelling in Social Media Analysis - Vera.ai
snippet: Details Fabio Giglietto's talk at the Digital Media Research Center of the Queensland University of Technology (QUT), where he discussed using OpenAI models to identify salient topics circulated via Facebook links during Italian general elections. He elaborated on techniques for constructing classifiers, performing cluster analysis, and utilizing Meta's URL Shares Dataset.
description: This vera.ai post details Fabio Giglietto's presentation at the Queensland University of Technology about using OpenAI models for topic modeling in social media analysis, particularly focusing on Facebook links during Italian general elections.

title: The Persistence and Resilience of Misinformation in the Face of Fact Checking - Vera.ai
snippet: Reports on a project facilitated by Fabio Giglietto and others at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School at the University of Amsterdam. The project analyzed a dataset of Facebook stories identified as problematic by Meta's fact-checkers, using OpenAI's GPT models and Mistral AI's embedding tools to identify topics and assess the quality of labels.
description: This article from vera.ai reports on a project facilitated by Fabio Giglietto at the Digital Media Initiative Winter School at the University of Amsterdam, which analyzed misinformation on Facebook using AI tools.

title: "A Pretty Blunt Approach": Meta's Political Content Reduction Policy and Italian Parliamentarians' Facebook Visibility | Sciety
snippet: This study, authored by Fabio Giglietto, examines the impact of Meta's political content reduction policy on the Facebook visibility of Italian parliamentarians using a dataset of over 2.5 million posts. It finds a significant reduction in reach for mainstream politicians and reveals transparency deficits in Meta's policy communication.
description: This Sciety article highlights a study by Fabio Giglietto that examines the impact of Meta's political content reduction policy on Italian parliamentarians' Facebook visibility, revealing a reduction in reach for mainstream politicians.
